I draw video game related fan art.

Big fan of Pokémon, The Legend of Zelda, Splatoon, Dragalia Lost, and pretty much anything Nintendo. I also make fake Pokémon, or “Fakemon” from time to time.

summary: There was a Pokemon Detective Pikachu contest that I entered which I didn’t win. I wanted to show off the picture, Pikachu and...
caption: There was a Pokemon Detective Pikachu contest that I entered which I didn’t win. I wanted to show off the picture, Pikachu and Tim looking for clues at a diner, where Pikachu thinks he has a lead with footprints. Enjoy!

blog.name: tigerlover16-uk
blog.title: Tiger Lover 16-UK
blog.description: Jack Humphreys, Age 24, From Wales. I'm a Christian, animal lover, an animation fan and a gigantic nerd. Fan of Spider-man, Dragon Ball, DC and Marvel Comics, MLP, Harry Potter and a variety of other shows, movies, comics and books. I'm just here to have fun, do some good and talk about the things i like (And sometimes the stuff I don't).

summary: I think it needs to be acknowledged that if Detective Pikachu comes out and it’s both really good and a big hit with audiences,...
body:
I think it needs to be acknowledged that if Detective Pikachu comes out and it’s both really good and a big hit with audiences, then the movie is going to be a franchise changing event. 

Warner Bros already have a sequel in the works, and there have been rumours for weeks now that they want to do spin-off films, so this could easily spawn into a big multi-movie series. It’ll probably bring in a good number of new fans and people who don’t normally play Pokémon, and make a lot more money than any of the animated films ever have.

It’s possible that these films could become the face of the franchise in the eyes of much of the public, or at least the younger generation of fans only just getting into Pokémon, in the same way the anime was back during the Pokémon boom of the 90′s/early 2000′s. We’ll probably be seeing more references to DP and probably other movies in the games, we might get a sequel game to Detective Pikachu to promote the sequel or something.

When people look back on the franchises history in about 10-20 years, pre-Detective Pikachu and Post-Detective Pikachu could very well be the lens through which a lot of people look at it.

Between this and a lot of other big developments for both the games and the anime this year, this year we’re probably looking at the start of a whole new era in the Pokémon franchises history. And I’m very curious to see what that era will be like

I think it needs to be acknowledged that if Detective Pikachu comes out and it’s both really good and a big hit with audiences, then the movie is going to be a franchise changing event. 

Warner Bros already have a sequel in the works, and there have been rumours for weeks now that they want to do spin-off films, so this could easily spawn into a big multi-movie series. It’ll probably bring in a good number of new fans and people who don’t normally play Pokémon, and make a lot more money than any of the animated films ever have.

It’s possible that these films could become the face of the franchise in the eyes of much of the public, or at least the younger generation of fans only just getting into Pokémon, in the same way the anime was back during the Pokémon boom of the 90′s/early 2000′s. We’ll probably be seeing more references to DP and probably other movies in the games, we might get a sequel game to Detective Pikachu to promote the sequel or something.

When people look back on the franchises history in about 10-20 years, pre-Detective Pikachu and Post-Detective Pikachu could very well be the lens through which a lot of people look at it.

Between this and a lot of other big developments for both the games and the anime this year, this year we’re probably looking at the start of a whole new era in the Pokémon franchises history. And I’m very curious to see what that era will be like

summary: You know, in the Detective Pikachu video game, there was a scene with the title character having a conversation with a Pikachu...
body:
You know, in the Detective Pikachu video game, there was a scene with the title character having a conversation with a Pikachu that’s implied to be Ash’s from the anime.

Wouldn’t it be neat if in the movie, there’s a scene where the main characters are in a restaurant or something, and in the background there are these 3 kids dressed up exactly like Ash, Misty and Brock, complete with the Brock actor having his eyes always closed and a Pikachu and Togepi sitting with them.

Like, it’s not an important scene, they’re just there clearly visible in the background of several shots, talking and doing their own thing, while our main characters discuss important plot stuff going on with them.

Bonus points if Jessie, James and Meowth are sitting at the other side of the restaurant wearing transparent disguises and trying too hard to look inconspicuous.

Hey, we’ve got Jigglypuff with a marker microphone already, so why not?

summary: Sonic the Hedgehog Movie Writer set for Detective Pikachu 2
title: Sonic the Hedgehog Movie Writer set for Detective Pikachu 2
body:
Sonic the Hedgehog Movie Writer set for Detective Pikachu 2

Although Detective Pikachu hasn’t been released yet, Warner Bros and Legendary Pictures are so confident that it will be a success they already started planning for a sequel.

It has been announced Sonic the Hedgehog movie screenwriter Oren Uziel will join the project. Uziel’s other credited projects include Netflix’s The Cloverfield Paradox.

Detective Pikachuis a upcoming film based on the…

summary: Most Anticipated Films of 2019.
title: Most Anticipated Films of 2019.
body:
Most Anticipated Films of 2019.

It’s hard to keep track of the upcoming releases. The emergence of streaming services has only broadened the options available to viewers with original content being produced at a rapid pace. However, there are some pretty epic blockbusters set to be released this year and these are some of my most anticipated.

1. Dark Phoenix (June 7th)

tags: he's saying you can shove it
summary: I've had this idea for a while after seeing the Detective Pikachu trailer. Cause Le Mime and Mr Mime have the same powers, and...
body:
I’ve had this idea for a while after seeing the Detective Pikachu trailer. Cause Le Mime and Mr Mime have the same powers, and Cat Omi and Pikachu are both yellow and furry. Jermaine is here too, cause I guess the plot of this ridiculous Xiaolin AU is that something happened that caused the end of the world, made the rest of the monks disappear and Omi turn into a cat again with no memory of it all, so Omi goes to get Jermaine’s help.

Omi is wearing a detective hat cause they tried to get Jack to help, and he agreed mostly cause he’s not safe from the danger either (and cause he kinda canonically cares for the monks, though he won’t admit it), but on the condition Omi wears the hat, cause Jack just seems like that kind of person.

Only the Jermaine panel is mostly traced from different screenshots from the show, I’m sorry, I don’t usually post the stuff I trace for practice, but for the sake of the comic, I’ll do it here. 🌿🐉

summary:
Detective Pikachu sequel in the making
...
caption:
Detective Pikachu sequel in the making

https://cottonfreakz.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/DetectivePikachusequel_Feat-300x300.png

When the first trailer arrived for Detective Pikachu, it was made abundantly clear that this thing is gonna rake in a ton of money at the box office. Legendary must be just as confident, because a sequel is already in the works well before the first movie’s premiere.

We won’t hear more of Ryan Reynolds as Pikachu in the full flick until it opens on May 10, but Legendary has hired Oren Uziel to write the sequel. Uziel previously worked on 22 Jump Street and The Cloverfield Paradox, and also has his name on Sonic the Hedgehog and Men in Black: International.

There currently aren’t any details on what the writer has planned, and that’s fine. Because, you know, we haven’t even seen Detective Pikachu yet! Check out the trailer, if you haven’t seen it yet

body:
Detective Pikachu?

Anyone want to chat with me about Detective Pikachu? Just finished the game and I have feelings! 😂😭 Would love to talk about spoilers from the game and the upcoming movie~ 💖
